text: Loved this game, though the large water world level was impossible to complete within that time frame. Also, freakin' loved the final fight with the lava guy and his robot.

text: This is still my favorite Bomberman game.
author: JelloApocalypse

text:
I had almost forgotten about this gem. I remember how frustrated I'd get trying to beat this game as a kid.
Good, good times. One of my faves.
author: Sunny Rustles

text: This game was so hard. I loved it though, never played anything like it since then.
author: Laughing Man

text: I was just going through the Bomberman 64 soundtrack 2 days ago!  Love this song (and many others from the soundtrack)!

text: I always preferred Bomberman Hero to this game. It had a great arcade sort of feel to it, and the soundtrack wasn't half bad either.

author: Goon

text: Rest in peace, Bomberman. You had great games. This game's staff roll theme is absolutely fantastic.
author: Hawlo

text: I really miss this series. I was actually looking forward to the 3DS game but now that I know it will never be, it's quite sad. Regardless, I loved this game's soundtrack and the 'twist' at the end.
author: Wardog 1991

text: My relationship with this game is purely love/hate. Not to say that it's "bad", just infuriating at times because of the difficulty. And again, not that that's a bad thing.
author: RascalTC

text: Bomberman 64: The Second Attack had a FANTASTIC OST (ontop of being my favorite Bomberman game). <3 I never played this one, but its got some great songs.
author: Zack The Great

text: man i remember spending so many hours on this game in multiplayer with my brother and our cousins, so much fun, and the music is cool
author: kemsus

text: Love the bass in this one. I have to say, I personally wasn't a big fan of the whole pumping the bomb mechanic this game introduced. The multiplayer in general wasn't as fun to me as the SNES games, but I liked the Adventure mode. It's fitting, I remember playing this game during the holidays. I also remember being impressed by the boxart because they added Bomberman's reflection on his bomb (I was easily impressed). Edit: I just realised there's also his reflection on the bomb in the Title! Doubly impressed.
author: SupraDarky

text: You're right the bass in this one is really good.  I have not played a Bomberman game before.  I also like how it sounds, it's calming yet upbeat kind of like some of the songs in Kirby's Epic Yarn.
author: Eric C.
